TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WebPartZoneBaseDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebZoneDesigner

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBaseDesigner> is the base class for <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneDesigner> and can be inherited to support custom implementations of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase> controls. <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBaseDesigner> extends its own base class, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebZoneDesigner>, by overriding the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBaseDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method to hide the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.VerbStyle%2A> property. Otherwise, the main purpose of this class for a control developer is that, unlike its parent, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBaseDesigner> has a public constructor so it can be inherited directly and used as a public implementation of the base class. For details, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebZoneDesigner>.

Docs.param: An of the set of properties associated with the control.
Docs.summary: Hides the property at design time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBaseDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method overrides <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> to hide the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.VerbStyle%2A> property in the designer after calling the parent method. This is because the default <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase> control does not render any zone-level verbs. If you wish to render zone-level verbs in a derived class, you must override this method to not hide the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.VerbStyle%2A> property.
